newsitem.title: USA: Firstar sees 3.25-4.25 pct credit chargeoff.
newsitem.headline: Firstar sees 3.25-4.25 pct credit chargeoff.

text.p: Firstar Corp, reporting a decline in first-quarter credit card chargeoffs from the previous quarter, said it expects such chargeoffs to remain in a range of 3.25 percent to 4.25 percent for the rest of the year.

For the first quarter of 1997, chargeoffs totaled 3.44 percent of average credit card loan outstandings, Firstar said. That was up from 3.20 percent a year ago but down from 5.11 percent in the 1996 fourth quarter.
Firstar earlier reported first-quarter earnings rose to $0.49 per share from $0.25 per share a year earlier.
